text:
With a large and growing number of users
within Razer's ecosystem of hardware,

software, and services,
Razer wanted a more personalized user

content across its applications
to empower the gamers further.

One way to do so is to recommend users
complementary hardware

given their existing device setup
and configuration, on Razer Synapse,
a software utility tool.

The challenge is for a small team
to maintain an infrastructure

that supports and scales the appropriate
resources for training and inferencing

of the recommendation algorithm
while being reliable,

accurate, and applicable across
multiple business domains.

Razer used Amazon Personalize
by training recommendation models

based on the different algorithms leveraging
advanced filtering and intelligent

user segmentations,
which creates personalized recommendations

that were then sent
both in batch and real time.
A strong statistical score

of the recommendation model is achieved
consistently and a click-through rate

that is ten times better than industry
standards is generated.

Razer saw an improvement
in time to market of the various software

product features for recommending hardware
while making it more convenient

for the team
to maintain a personalization system.
